intro: Aristocapsa insignis, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Aristocapsa insignis is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
